item.title: Láº­p trÃ¬nh hÆ°á»›ng Ä‘á»‘i tÆ°á»£ng (OOP) trong Java
item.description:
Láº­p trÃ¬nh hÆ°á»›ng Ä‘á»‘i tÆ°á»£ng trong Java

Láº­p trÃ¬nh hÆ°á»›ng Ä‘á»‘i tÆ°á»£ng (OOP) lÃ  má»™t paradigm láº­p trÃ¬nh quan trá»ng trong Java. BÃ i viáº¿t nÃ y sáº½ giá»›i thiá»‡u cÃ¡c khÃ¡i niá»‡m cÆ¡ báº£n cá»§a OOP.

}

item.title: Java Collections Framework
item.description:
Java Collections Framework

Java Collections Framework cung cáº¥p cÃ¡c lá»›p vÃ  interface Ä‘á»ƒ lÃ m viá»‡c vá»›i cÃ¡c táº­p há»£p dá»¯ liá»‡u.

CÃ¡c loáº¡i Collections chÃ­nh

List

  • ArrayList
  • LinkedList
  • Vector

  • HashSet
  • TreeSet
  • LinkedHashSet

Map

  • HashMap
  • TreeMap
  • LinkedHashMap

VÃ­ dá»¥ sá»­ dá»¥ng

import java.util.*;

public class CollectionExample {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        // ArrayList
        List<String> names = new ArrayList<>();
        names.add("Java");
        names.add("Python");
        
        // HashSet
        Set<Integer> numbers = new HashSet<>();
        numbers.add(1);
        numbers.add(2);
        
        // HashMap
        Map<String, Integer> ages = new HashMap<>();
        ages.put("Alice", 25);
        ages.put("Bob", 30);
    }
}

item.title: Java Streams API - Láº­p trÃ¬nh hÃ m
item.description:
Java Streams API

Streams API Ä‘Æ°á»£c giá»›i thiá»‡u trong Java 8 Ä‘á»ƒ há»— trá»£ láº­p trÃ¬nh hÃ m vÃ  xá»­ lÃ½ dá»¯ liá»‡u má»™t cÃ¡ch khai bÃ¡o.

CÃ¡c thao tÃ¡c cÆ¡ báº£n

List<Integer> numbers = Arrays.asList(1, 2, 3, 4, 5);

// Filter
numbers.stream()
    .filter(n -> n > 2)
    .forEach(System.out::println);

// Map
numbers.stream()
    .map(n -> n * 2)
    .collect(Collectors.toList());

// Reduce
int sum = numbers.stream()
    .reduce(0, Integer::sum);

item.title: ES6 - JavaScript Modern
item.description:
ES6 (ECMAScript 2015) - TiÃªu chuáº©n JavaScript Hiá»‡n Ä‘áº¡i

ES6 mang Ä‘áº¿n nhiá»u tÃ­nh nÄƒng má»›i giÃºp láº­p trÃ¬nh JavaScript dá»… dÃ ng hÆ¡n.

CÃ¡c tÃ­nh nÄƒng chÃ­nh

1. Arrow Functions

// Traditional
const add = function(a, b) {
    return a + b;
}

// Arrow
const add = (a, b) => a + b;

2. Template Literals

const name = "Báº£o";
const message = `Hello ${name}!`;

3. Destructuring

const person = { name: "Báº£o", age: 20 };
const { name, age } = person;

const [a, b] = [1, 2];

4. Classes

class Car {
    constructor(brand) {
        this.brand = brand;
    }
    
    drive() {
        console.log(`${this.brand} is driving`);
    }
}

item.title: JavaScript Async/Await - Xá»­ lÃ½ báº¥t Ä‘á»“ng bá»™
item.description:
Async/Await trong JavaScript

Async/Await lÃ  cÃ¡ch hiá»‡n Ä‘áº¡i Ä‘á»ƒ xá»­ lÃ½ báº¥t Ä‘á»“ng bá»™ trong JavaScript, lÃ m cho code dá»… Ä‘á»c hÆ¡n.

So sÃ¡nh Callback, Promise, vÃ  Async/Await

Callback Hell

fetchUser(id, function(user) {
    fetchPosts(user.id, function(posts) {
        fetchComments(posts[0].id, function(comments) {
            console.log(comments);
        });
    });
});

Promise Chain

fetchUser(id)
    .then(user => fetchPosts(user.id))
    .then(posts => fetchComments(posts[0].id))
    .then(comments => console.log(comments))
    .catch(error => console.error(error));

Async/Await

async function getComments(id) {
    try {
        const user = await fetchUser(id);
        const posts = await fetchPosts(user.id);
        const comments = await fetchComments(posts[0].id);
        console.log(comments);
    } catch (error) {
        console.error(error);
    }
}

Async/Await lÃ m code trÃ´ng giá»‘ng nhÆ° synchronous nhÆ°ng thá»±c táº¿ lÃ  báº¥t Ä‘á»“ng bá»™.

item.title: DOM Manipulation vá»›i JavaScript
item.description:
Thao tÃ¡c DOM vá»›i JavaScript

DOM (Document Object Model) lÃ  giao diá»‡n Ä‘á»ƒ tÆ°Æ¡ng tÃ¡c vá»›i HTML tá»« JavaScript.

Chá»n pháº§n tá»­

// getElementById
const element = document.getElementById('myId');

// querySelector
const element = document.querySelector('.myClass');
const elements = document.querySelectorAll('.item');

// getElementByClassName
const elements = document.getElementsByClassName('myClass');

Sá»­a Ä‘á»•i ná»™i dung

const element = document.getElementById('myId');

// Sá»­a text
element.textContent = 'Hello World';

// Sá»­a HTML
element.innerHTML = '<p>New content</p>';

// Sá»­a thuá»™c tÃ­nh
element.setAttribute('data-value', '123');
element.style.color = 'red';

Event Handling

const button = document.getElementById('myButton');

button.addEventListener('click', function() {
    console.log('Button clicked!');
});

// Hoáº·c vá»›i arrow function
button.addEventListener('click', () => {
    console.log('Button clicked!');
});

DOM Manipulation lÃ  ná»n táº£ng cá»§a web development vá»›i vanilla JavaScript.

item.title: Spring Boot - Khá»Ÿi Ä‘áº§u nhanh
item.description:

Spring Boot Ä‘Æ¡n giáº£n hÃ³a viá»‡c táº¡o á»©ng dá»¥ng Spring, giáº£m boilerplate code.

Cáº¥u trÃºc cÆ¡ báº£n

import org.springframework.boot.SpringApplication;
import org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.SpringBootApplication;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.GetMapping;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RestController;

@SpringBootApplication
public class Application {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        SpringApplication.run(Application.class, args);
    }
}

@RestController
public class HelloController {
    @GetMapping("/hello")
    public String hello() {
        return "Hello World!";
    }
}

CÃ¡c tÃ­nh nÄƒng chÃ­nh

  • Auto-configuration
  • Embedded server (Tomcat, Jetty, Undertow)

item.title: React - ThÆ° viá»‡n Frontend hiá»‡n Ä‘áº¡i
item.description:
React - XÃ¢y dá»±ng UI vá»›i Components

React lÃ  thÆ° viá»‡n JavaScript giÃºp xÃ¢y dá»±ng giao diá»‡n ngÆ°á»i dÃ¹ng tÆ°Æ¡ng tÃ¡c dá»… dÃ ng.

Component cÆ¡ báº£n

// Functional Component
function Welcome(props) {
    return <h1>Hello {props.name}</h1>;
}

// Hoáº·c vá»›i arrow function
const Welcome = (props) => {
    return <h1>Hello {props.name}</h1>;
};

// JSX
const element = <Welcome name="Báº£o" />;

Hooks

import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';

function Counter() {
    const [count, setCount] = useState(0);
    
    useEffect(() => {
        console.log('Component mounted or count changed');
    }, [count]);
    
    return (
        <div>
            <p>Count: {count}</p>
            <button onClick={() => setCount(count + 1)}>
                Increment
            </button>
        </div>
    );
}

Virtual DOM

React sá»­ dá»¥ng Virtual DOM Ä‘á»ƒ tá»‘i Æ°u hÃ³a rendering, chá»‰ update nhá»¯ng pháº§n thay Ä‘á»•i.

item.title: Git - Quáº£n lÃ½ phiÃªn báº£n code
